website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 has some issues with image noise at medium sensitivities, but is otherwise a solid entry in the tough camera category.
cons: Not as wide-angle as other tough cameras
Similar cameras can go deeper underwater

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Update, won't charge or turn on now. Have only used it three times. Buyer beware. Great underwater pictures! I'm very pleased so far! One downside is that you're forced to read through all of the underwater warnings when you turn the camera on in snorkel mode. It's like, "I GET IT" - clean it carefully! The batter doesn't last more than a couple of hours of charge but it's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Laurenantics

customer_reviews.title: Dust on Sensor bad service
customer_reviews.text: Got dust on the sensor in a couple of months, for a water proof and dust proof unit was disappointed. I buy two of these cameras for work every 1-2 years I sent this in for service 3 weeks ago and Panasonic was going to call me back and never did, also they had no idea when I would get it or the status of the unit. The image quality is ok, slow at time to capture the image, poor low light capability. I was going to purchase a Panasonic mirrorless unit, but after this I think I'll look at another manufacturer. I have purchased 6 of these for my business and this was the last one.
customer_reviews.author: streetglide18

customer_reviews.title: Good photos, great videos, takes a beating.
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale for $200, and I have beaten the heck out of it. It takes good photos. Not great photos. I have an SLR that takes great photos. I don't carry my SLR with me when I go kayak fishing, however. Or sailing. Surprisingly, I've used the camera more for videos than for photography. I started posting shop videos on YouTube, and I discovered that, with decent lighting, this camera takes great HD video. Again, I'd rather have this camera in my shop, with all the dust and smoke, than my SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rose

customer_reviews.title: 3 years or more is good value for my $
customer_reviews.text: Daily use for last year or more... very reliable camera... taken it swimming several times, though it's not a regular thing. I have recently noticed the red / white moisture checkers inside are showing... though the camera is functioning properly still. My last one gave up the seal and failed when wet after a couple years (that was a TS-3 model) I guess some attention must be paid to replacing the seal, etc... but honestly, I'll probably just buy another camera when this one quits... 3 years or more is good value for my $... I take thousands of pictures a year... still cheaper than film!
customer_reviews.author: Royce Williams

customer_reviews.title: The camera takes amazing photos. It has limited manual features which could ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with same-day delivery for my trip to Hawaii. I needed an underwater camera in case I hit the beaches or pools. I also was looking forward to the WiFi capabilities, but the WiFi is such a pain to setup. You have to sign-up for the Lumixclub, which is a challenge in itself. Then configure which services you want to send your photos. Then configure the camera to connect to the Lumixclub. The camera takes amazing photos. It has limited manual features which could be helpful. A really neat feature is the time lapse capabilities. I was able to do a really neat time-lapse of the clouds over Ko O'lina
customer_reviews.author: Damaged Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for a quality point-and-shoot waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my third waterproof camera. This one has served me well with waterproof abilities in shallow water but really lacks photo quality. The photos (in all types of light) tend to be very blotchy and grainy when zoomed up. I like big prints so this just won't cut it. The focus on this camera is also finicky. If you're taking quick pictures you must slow down and ensure that focus has locked or you'll end up with a fuzzy photo. If you only view digital pics or prints smaller than 5x7, this camera will likely suit you well. If you like to go big and take action shots, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a recent trip to the Dominican Republic. It was great going in the ocean and hiking in waterfalls. The GPS worked very well, but does take a little while to lock sometimes. I used the trail function one day, then uploaded the file to an online site to decode it, and it worked great. I haven't done much with the wi-fi, it does seem to be not the best feature. I'm happy with the quality of the photos, both underwater (close range) and normal. It has a lot of fun features, many of which I haven't fully utilized so far :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Guericke

customer_reviews.title: This is possibly the best camera we've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the best camera we've ever owned. It's been 30 feet under water recording sea turtles and caverns, and it's been to the summit of Mauna Kea (roughly 14,000 feet). It's been dropped, tossed, bounced around in luggage, and generally treated as if it were a rock. It still takes AWESOME pictures. Combined with the Panasonic Image App for Android, it makes transferring pictures a breeze. My only gripe is the incredibly weird structure of the way videos are stored. I don't get that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Camera worked great both on land and in the water
customer_reviews.text: Camera worked great both on land and in the water. There was no trouble using it after it had been in the water, as I had read in some other reviews. Had some problems, but these would likely be improved with continued use of and familiarization with the camera. I unknowingly got sand on the lens with no clear water to flush it out, resulting in some blurred photographs. It was also somewhat difficult to navigate the color settings. The battery died more quickly than I anticipated, so I missed some photo ops. I would recommend having a spare battery with you.
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: Best underwater point-and-shoot camera we've owned yet
customer_reviews.text: We've owned underwater, "tough" digitial cameras from Fujifilm and Olympus, both of which have filled up with water or had the autofocus stop working, and otherwise fail on us. We've had this Panasonic for almost a year now, and it works perfectly every time. It has a ton of features, and the bells and whistles may be too much for some people, but just performing as advertised is the largest point of satisfaction we've had so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pittinger

customer_reviews.title: The best compact camera I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best all purpose camera I have ever had. I've taken it swimming, Kayaking and on numerous vacations in all kinds of climates. It's been dropped, dunked and very cold. I've had it for 2 years now and I love it. The picture quality is great. Almost as good as my DSLR camera. The only down side is I wish there was a way to increase the zoom on this type of camera. It's easy to use. my grand kids who are 3 and 5 love to take pictures with it too.
customer_reviews.author: penvan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great underwater camera that also doubles as a regular digital ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great underwater camera that also doubles as a regular digital camera that is great for use in humid, rainy, snowy conditions as well. This is my third Lumix camera and they are excellent digital cameras, user-friendly. Lumix was first recommended to me by a relative in the camera business and he owned one, also... Here are some underwater pictures I took of honu here in Hawaii:
customer_reviews.author: danabanana

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera but no GoPro
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera, does work in cold and wet places. I have not placed it under water, but have been in the ruff water getting splashed on with no issues. It have very clear pictures and video's and is easy to start and stop video's. The only issue with this is its size. It is NOT a GoPro replacement as there is no attachments available and its heavy. But if you don't mind holding it, its a very good camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this products
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my camera, i use it every weekend whitewater kayaking, taking a very very large quantity of the videos and photos in very cold and rough conditions. I chose this among others because this can record in 60FPS (so you can make slo motions video after), i have followed the instructions (cleaning the battery door), and it has worked perfectly, not a single drop of water inside the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.  Bad Software
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the Lumix Tough series of digital cameras. Short of professional-grade equipment, they're the best cameras for going snorkeling/hiking/camping with. The GPS/compass/barometer features are great. I love being able to see where I took pictures later on. Also I've used these line of cameras for years without any problems. Pros: * great screen * great picture quality * very rugged The cons: * slow software. cycling through pictures or zooming in on them can take a long time (multiple seconds between button pushes and screen updates). this wasn't an issue on my DMC-TS4 (it's predecessor) * the wifi link software is lame... like most software hardware manufacturers write (with the exception of Apple).
customer_reviews.author: Saurav Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to use while camping and fishing. It was replacing an Olympus TG-839 that I was not happy with the quality on. I am happy with the features, battery and image quality. I haven't tested the waterproof feature yet. I am docking a star because you can not charge the battery in the camera. This was a positive of the Olympus. This camera has USB style ports but they are only for output to a TV (do people really do that?) and to connect to a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera...
customer_reviews.text: ...after buying two other brands that didn't last. Takes great photos! Has worked underwater for two ocean vacations, be sure to rinse it! Found myself grabbing this for everyday photos too and leaving my dslr in the room. My son took it on a backpacking and rafting trip and dropped it in the river. The guide dove in after it and got it back, everything still working great! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dawgdaze

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: Good for what I need it for. Took FOREVER to figure out the wifi connection. Holding it against a wifi device (ie ipad) did not work. Tried on iphone and ipod still no success. I researched a lot in this camera and can't figure out how to do anything on it except taking the pictures and changing which setting the picture is to be on. Can't figure out how to do a time lapse video that it says. The manual is awful. For this I give it 3 stars. If it wasn't so complicated trying to figure things out I'd rate better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: user friendly and I love the color since it's easily noticeable (hard to loose ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this before my trip to Cancun since I will be doing a lot of water acitivites. It's light, user friendly and I love the color since it's easily noticeable (hard to loose it in the water). The picture came out great!
customer_reviews.author: Miu

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, I've already recommended it.
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, has a tendency to focus on krill, etc underwater rather than the fish (if there is a lot of it), but it's severed me well 80% of the time. This is the first surface water camera I've owned, I've always used a housing on a DSLR, but I just upgraded and the housing was out of stock for my DSLR. Photos from Fiji with no post pro color correction (which is needed with underwater photography) Take your time to learn how to use it before you jump in the water!.
customer_reviews.author: Epic_Earth_enDjinn

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS AWESOME!!! Tough is the word!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AWESOME!!! You won't believe the stuff you can do with under-water shots and with a decent tripod, you can get some really sharp top-amateur-quality shots extremely close-up with this camera. My teenage son has loved getting tight shots with amazing detail of critters of all kinds, plants, fish... and really cool underwater videos. Tough is the word!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: We love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: We have taken this camera on a cruise so we've had it at the beach and took it in the ocean while snorkeling. We followed all the directions of letting the camera dry before opening to take the SD card out. It's great to have since we always worried about taking our big 35mm camera to a beach. And we couldn't take it in the water. It takes panoramic shots and has lots of picture modes. We have a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5 that we've had for years and loved so that's why we decided to purchase this Panasonic to have to take to the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Bright

customer_reviews.title: leaky - buy at own risk
customer_reviews.text: While the camera performs well, my original one leaked at first underwater usage and its replacement (free from Amazon) leaked after 2 years. This was despite my scrupulous attention to ensure the seals were clean and the camera openings securely closed. I would not trust this product to be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: We're now ready to capture NESSIE (digitally of course)
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera has a nice sturdy feel to it. Takes very nice pictures and super video. Be aware that is comes with a puny 10mb onboard memory so if you dont have a sd card you will be able to take one picture before you fill it up. Luckily amazon has nice big SDXC cards (we got the Sony 64gb) for good prices so get one of them when you get the camera.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weis

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. Takes great pictures both in and out of water. I was a little nervous about using it in the water but everything worked great. It is nice having a camera that you don't have to worry if some water gets on it. Battery and SD card were not affected when submerged in water. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a camera to use near or in water activities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked 30 min into trip
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely careful and made sure seal was clean prior to inserting battery into brand new device, yet it stopped working after 30 min. Upon inspection back at hotel, it was flooded with water. It was never more that 1 foot under water. Lost opportunity for pictures during once in a lifetime trip to Bora Bora. Amazon was great an refunded the cost, but I cant get a refund on the memories I couldn't capture. Beyond disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: The TS5 is an awesome travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I own the exact same camera, purchased about 2 years prior to this purchase. The TS5 is an awesome travel camera. It is fast to focus, very durable, has very good battery life and easy to use in most basic modes. I purchased a second one for a family member who is doing a lot of traveling and had borrowed mine - and loved it. This is a discontinued camera - I'm not sure why Panasonic decided to do so, however; if you can find a new one: they are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: William Karstens

customer_reviews.title: A great camera to own for water and underwater activities
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a camera that can take pictures in and out of the water equally well. It takes some getting used to how to set it up when coming from a Canon brand. I was able to test it's remote control-ability from a phone and it works flawless. Setup is a bit complicated at first. I have taken this camera down to 5m and it works flawlessly. The key is making sure the lock of the battery compartment is engaged. Love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: TheMatrix

customer_reviews.title: replacement of an older lumix
customer_reviews.text: I bought the older Lumix camera 2 years ago and used it in Hawaii. We took pictures of underwater turtles and tropical fish. Two years later, i noticed the camera would have issues with the screen and saving pictures. It turns out water was leaking into the camera. I've tried GoPro and Samsung but I think this camera provides the best < 40 feet underwater pics. One sad thing is the condensation that can build on the lens / view finder. It can ruin a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Keun-young Anthony Kim

customer_reviews.title: The camera takes great pictures, even under water
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes great pictures, even under water. I have taken it snorkeling twice and too the beach many more times and so far I have run into no issues with water leakage. The battery leaves a little to be desired but if you have a back up on hand it is no problem to switch them out as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a dive trip for photos and video, it worked great, certainly waterproof, I free dove down to 30+ feet repeatedly with no issues, a larger camera would have been a huge hindrance as I was breath-hold diving, this worked great. My only complaint is that you need to take the camera off the default video setting to ensure that the video is easily played on your device rather than from the camera itself.
customer_reviews.author: moosel

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, tajes great quality pictures, almost too good :-). Definately water proof. Says not to use in the hot tub,but did anyway, and have had no problems. It Iis a bit heavier than I would like, but the pictures and versatileness of the camera, became my go to camera thatI would lug around with me, I have another camera that fits in your pocket and much lighter and takes great pics also, but cant get wet. So I found myself leaving that one behind.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Great "Tough" point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a camera that we could take on vacation and not have to treat it like a delicate flower. We took it on vacation: sand, surf, boating, snorkeling, swimming pools, rain, hiking, car traveling out-the-window shots. We took over 2000 pictures/videos. Couldn't think of a better test for this rugged camera. I couldn't do that with my other camera. Easy enough for my whole family to operate without taking a course to learn to operate it! Still reviewing the pics! I'm not a professional photographer, and I haven't had time to even load the advance features software yet, but I'm already very satisfied. Anything that I'll learn from here on out is a Plus!
customer_reviews.author: Victor S.

customer_reviews.title: great underwater companion
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, i bought it to replace a TS1 and it's really amazing. good picture quality, lots of extra features as wi-fi and gps. What i liked the most is the non-touch screen compared to almost all competitors, this works a lot better in the sand, or with wet hands. tough camera.
customer_reviews.author: Osky

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Set up is impossible. I'm extremely tech savvy and none of the instructions in the manual work on the camera. Buttons don't light up. I just wasted money as I didn't pull it out of the box to play with the camera until 3 months later, so we can no longer exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Vi Y.

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect companion for an adventurer
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect companion for an adventurer. We have taken it everywhere. To the snow, in the ocean and just in the rain. You don't need to worry about breaking it. Just remember to rinse it in fresh water after you have used it in salt water. As the body will start to eat away after a while. that is what happened to our first one. Now it is perfect as we look after it better.
customer_reviews.author: Sofie

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality for the price, no RAW support
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works well underwater. Great image quality for the price, but no raw images as would be expected at this price point. The white balance and dynamic range are really good. There's no shutter lag and the startup time is quick. You have to be careful when using this camera as if water enters the battery compartment the camera will not function. The window might fog up from the inside.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera -Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. Durable, takes great shots, built for the outdoorsman. We abuse the heck out of this whether we are in 100+deg heat or negative temps skiing. This is a great unit for a climber, surfer...family man/woman. I did a ton of research on the best water resistant cameras... this unit definitely holds up to all the accolades given it. I've owned this for 1year.
customer_reviews.author: Christian John Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes beautiful pictures! And of course the good thing about it is that you can take it under water with you. I've used it for snorkeling a couple of times and it did the job. The only thing is that when it is underwater the pictures aren't as good... But other than that it's what i've been looking for for a while. It's pretty bulky but I guess that's a good thing since it's suppose to be "Tough" and I've dropped it a few times and nothing was wrong with it. I would recommend if you are looking for a camera that can go under water with you and not have to worry about a case.
customer_reviews.author: Ly S.

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are right- great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from a week long trip to Mexico, and I brought the camera. The pictures are very good quality, and the waterproof feature allows you to use just one camera all trip long. The best feature for snorkeling is the photo blast option. It snaps a number of pictures in just a second, which almost guarantees that you will get a great angle or pose from whatever you were trying to get a picture of. Pictures at night also came out pretty well, and that is a peeve of mine with most other cameras. I did the research before I purchased this camera and I'm so glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Falco

customer_reviews.title: Great Features....poor power
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Lumix camera. The features in this DMC-TS5D are a definitely upgraded and easy to understand. What has me scratching my head is the old school power supply. It does have a small battery but the charger is old school. Instead of building the charger with a direct plug it has a cord to plug-in. Another cord to keep up with is not something I think is an upgrade to match the other features of the camera. I probably not keep this long.
customer_reviews.author: NRamey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera for more than a year and it has always - ALWAYS, ALWAYS, ALWAYS - done what was asked of it, from operating underwater to being banged around relentlessly. If what you're looking for is a tough and functional camera, this is the one to choose.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: delivers great pictures and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: third one of these I've owned - bought a similar Nikon but the selections (e.g. flash off) reset each time the camera was shut off - the Lumix keeps the settings until you change them. minor issue - the new chargers have a cord and the green LED signals 'charging' - the old ones were smaller and plugged directly into the wall with a two/tone LED for charging and charged. Still, delivers great pictures and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Hick

customer_reviews.title: Takes good pictures but is not as easy to operate as ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures but is not as easy to operate as my last Lumix. Not as "intuitive" as it could be. Only has a 5 to 1 zoom, while other none waterproof Lumix models have much more. It will do for my kayak work, but I think I should have gotten the regular Lumix and gone with a GoPro for my other wetter needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Tar

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater
customer_reviews.text: Took this snorkeling in Tahiti for a week. Worked great underwater, both still and movie mode. LCD screen is nice and bright. Wish the dry land shots were a little more vibrant, but I'm kind of a camera snob lately. The NFC function to transfer photos to my cell phone was kind of tricky to learn, but worked eventually. Haven't dropped it yet so can't comment on the toughness.
customer_reviews.author: Beth in Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera, awesome for travel. The GPS is particularly handy. Somewhat annoying video file format but generally usable. The wifi is lacking, really clunky but it does work, just not well. You won't use it. The biggest problem, it leaks. Kinda defeats the purpose. I followed all the instructions to the letter but water still found its way in. Foggy lens and rear screen. I'm going to try to send it back for a replacement. I'll update the review when I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Beach Camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera. It has numerous auto settings for a variety of lighting conditions. This is an excellent all-around camera that's perfect for travel. It's sturdy, lightweight and easy to use. Fast focus and sharp images. I've used it mostly for taking snapshots at the beach. The wide angle landscape mode produces beautiful results.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Challis

customer_reviews.title: Little Super camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just what I expected. It has some very interesting features like face recognition and geolocation via the built in GPS which tells you where you are regarding earth’s notable touristic places. Others, which you would expect in a regular camera, are of very easy operation. Compact, amazing image quality, underwater operation, and all that in a sturdy case – believe me, it is as advertised as I could inadvertently verify. What else could someone wish! Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Mauro C

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent camera with tons of features
customer_reviews.text: This camera has all the bells and whistles. The first one I had crapped out on me on vacation so I had to send it in for warranty. They sent me a new one and it seems to work well. Holds up well in the ocean and I love being able to automatically transfer photos to my phone just by touching it to the phone!
customer_reviews.author: Attarax

customer_reviews.title: great camera. If you have lines when you play ...
customer_reviews.text: great camera. If you have lines when you play back video on your computer be sure to change the video format to mp4 on the camera.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Durability, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: The camera is very versatile and quite ruggedly built - has been through several tropical adventure tours without incident. Not an experienced camera person but came highly recommended by profession photographers for my needs. Excellent picture and video quality. Would recommend upgraded storage or SD card. The battery needs to be charged very frequently though - my only complaint. Overall excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ANietrze

customer_reviews.title: took ours to bora bora and worked great underwater as well as above
customer_reviews.text: took ours to bora bora and worked great underwater as well as above. great all in one camera. they do sell chargers that you can charge the battery outside of the unit and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND doing this so you can charge extra batteries to have available and carry in the case as we do so you never have to worry. But do not open the battery door when camera is wet to change the battery!!
customer_reviews.author: Lora L Repka

customer_reviews.title: Good choice, no-frills, decent picture quality, wifi. What more can you ask for this price?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a point-and-shoot, full-auto, simple-to-operate camera that could resist water and sand, and it's just what I got. In all other situations, I use my Nikon DSLR or my Sony RX100, where I have much more control over the outcome (and I shoot RAW with those two cameras), but my new no-risk option to get that nice shot right "in the water" (not "close to" the water) is my Panasonic Lumix. It shoots JPEG but it's perfectly Ok for what I need in those situations.
customer_reviews.author: rjalvarezb

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, excellent alternative to Sony TX30 and Olympus TG-3
customer_reviews.text: From a simple user, is a good camera. I had a Sony TX10 before and the photos from TS5 are more beautiful. Very good point and shoot. I consider an excellent alternative to Sony TX30 that doesn't have wifi and GPS and Olympus TG-3 that is more expensive. The con is that in the second day the camera got wet with some use in pool. But the Amazon/Panasonic returned the item and I bought a new one because I liked it. Without problem in this time.
customer_reviews.author: Fabiano S.

customer_reviews.title: Rugged effective GPS camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pictures for a portable, thought point and shoot. GPS after the updates world's very well. The addition of places names for pictures taken while the whole the GPS is attempting to log on is a bit and miss. Overall love the camera and quality. It's a shame panasonic is getting out of cameras! Especially rugged ones
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Hussein

customer_reviews.title: Dip it in water as much as you like...
customer_reviews.text: Its waterproof, I was surprised by its quality and the sharpness of the photo. Dip it in water as much as you like...
customer_reviews.author: David I.

customer_reviews.title: it worked great! No issues transferring the pictures to my cell
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera on two trips, in Costa Rica and in Iceland, it worked great! No issues transferring the pictures to my cell. Then I brought it with me to Ecuador recently and it will not turn on! I bought multiple batteries for it and accessories and now that's all garbage because it does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, Simple Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes good quality video and pictures. It's pretty easy to focus it correctly. The only problem with it is when making videos on Movie Maker, the first second of the video is completely unusable because it freezes. It has a lot of weird extra features but they don't get in the way, so you can treat it as a point and shoot just fine. Never had a problem with leakage or anything. Took it in both the ocean and pools and they were both fine. Overall, awesome camera!
customer_reviews.author: K. Putland

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: It worked super well! I used this camera when we went to the Caribbean. I went snorkeling with turtles and the pictures were fantastic! They were clear and the color was pretty good. My husband dove down about 25 feet and took close up pictures of the sea turtles. No water leaks.
customer_reviews.author: SAKunz

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this camera for over 4 years now and it’s been reliable and high quality for me the entire time. I take underwater pictures (less than a foot deep) with no ill effects even after all this time. Battery life is still solid too. It’s my favorite point and shoot camera I’ve ever used, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Kopperud

customer_reviews.title: Good camera. Love the blue color
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. Love the blue color. Awesome inside the water but also outside. Love the GPS function. Flash at night could be better, but it has everything that I need in a compact camera. Takes great pics and videos, see samples!!
customer_reviews.author: Chema

customer_reviews.title: Best Amphibious Camera?
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality excellent but it won't (As any other camera I seen of it's type shoot Raw images) Service depth rated for 43 ft. I've taken it down to that depth with no problems. Battery life excellent. HDR and Panorama mode work great. This camera lives with me in Canoe. In truck, at parties, everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ho'okele. I take reviews seriously! I am not paid.Peeps are getting bogus reviews..

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but was disappointed the battery charger required ...
customer_reviews.text: Third Panosonic water camera. Love the product but was disappointed the battery charger required cord to plug in not just the base itself. Was more combiner for travel and storing. Older version was just the battery base, simplier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, worked well in the water scuba diving and the photo quality is really nice! Great all around camera for traveling so you don't have to worry about it dropping and breaking. I got some great shots in the ocean that I wouldn't have ever thought of getting because I never had a tough camera like this. Easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: MDami

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I take it mountain climbing with me, it sits in my sweaty pocket and takes pictures in the rain without skipping a beat. Lens has yet to fog up on me yet. Picture quality sure beats my Galaxy S3. Panorama photos are easy to take and look great. The only con for me is the GPS time is off a time zone, there is probably a setting for it but I haven't really looked into it because I have my time stamp set manually for where I am. Would recommend, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vitalla Zangerth

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera, it is my gorilla camera that I can pull out of a pocket while biking, kayaking, canoeing, or hiking and capture anything quickly, weather be da^#$d. Panorama is fun and I also love the zoom macro mode since I do a lot of close up work too. Why they had to make hooking up to wifi so difficult is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: kkpurplehaze

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot.  Buttons are a little small for my XL hands.  Uses batteries and memory fast, so need extra memory cards and ba
customer_reviews.text: I would buy it again. Takes good pictures. The panoramic function is primo!. I like the special button on top just for video. Takes some time to get used to like most electronics. Close up shots are primo too. I recommend the "must have accessory kit for Panisonic Lumix"
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC - TS5A Quick Review
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera!! First and foremost, it takes great pictures. And the HD video is incredible. The second big thing for me is its water resistance. I’ve taken it to the depth of 20 feet with no issues. That’s enough for me, I only snorkel. It can go twice as deep. When you get the camera wet, rinse it with tap water and then let it completely dry before you open the battery / memory card compartment. The third thing I like is the WiFi function. You can transfer pictures / videos, and control the camera using the Wifi. The GPS feature is cool, but I don’t really use it. :)
customer_reviews.author: craig kent

customer_reviews.title: Good for Point and Shoot All Weather fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife to use for her dog training videos. It takes pretty decent point-and-click photos. The video is pretty sharp as well. The only hang up with it is the Wi-Fi connectivity. There are some issues with connecting and downloading through it's Wi-Fi with an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: I took some great pictures with this camera while snorkeling in Belize
customer_reviews.text: I took some great pictures with this camera while snorkeling in Belize. I did my research and ended up with this camera and it provided no issues. You have to obviously make sure that nothing is in the way of the closure that houses the battery and the memory card, and you also have to soak it in fresh water after each use for 10min. These are all on the instructions, so READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. I am glad that I got this camera...it also made for a good sidekick to my DSLR for quick point and shoots.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: love the camera
customer_reviews.text: love the camera. still trying out many of the features (some of which I have no need of) but I do a lot of fishing trips and the ability to keep this camera dry is a big plus. the stills and videos really create beautiful pictures.
customer_reviews.author: LTC

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It worked so well on our vacation to the beach. I was able to get some amazing under water pictures of the reef. This took great pictures in and out of the water. The orange color is great, very easy to find when you drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Annoying messages
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is good quality. I use it to do prebuyer home inspections, so I take lots of photos. The zoom is limited over the standard camera from Panasonic . Every time I open the side compartment to load a disc the underwater message come on. Another challenge is the location of the video button. It is too easy to hit it while trying to hit the shutter release button
customer_reviews.author: Greg Madsen

customer_reviews.title: it is a good camera with a nice video and photos underwater
customer_reviews.text: I knew about this camera for my oldest son so I bought it for my youngest son, it is a good camera with a nice video and photos underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Aymerich

customer_reviews.title: ... take pics remotely (actually seeing the camera viewfinder is like having a remote video camera whether or not you ...
customer_reviews.text: We used the internal WIFI feature to broadcast the viewfinder to an iPad (no Internet connections required) and take pics remotely (actually seeing the camera viewfinder is like having a remote video camera whether or not you are recording) BUT if you lose line-of-sight communication with the WIFI device it bombs out. You can connect each of the two (camera and tablet or computer) to the internet and the issue goes away, but in that case there may be a data charge. Not good. Otherwise a nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: Thomaas M. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is awesome..
customer_reviews.text: Camera screen started flickering after about 3 months of regular use. All instructions on ensuring watertight integrity were followed precisely including a thorough freshwater cleaning after each use. I tried talking to Panasonic and they were unable to help. Picture quality is awesome...when I can get it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence F. Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Remember, this is not a pro grade digital camera with pro results. It is a great digital that offers lots of features and quite a few options for manual settings. The case is slick to the touch, I put rough adhesive on mine at various spots to keep me from dropping it. I bought mine for outdoor photos while camping, biking, hiking, and fishing. Works great for photos and video. Complete with GPS and compass. I would not hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and tough with good pix.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for over a year. Its been a really good camera with clean pix. Very happy with the color balance. Pretty easy to use although navigating the menus gets tiresome. Appreciate the GPS tagging more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: mhamilton

customer_reviews.title: This one of the best quick shot camera I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This one of the best quick shot camera I've ever owned, the GPS feature is a nice feature when you want to return to those places in the photos and with a bunch of shooting feature that help get the shot right, you can't go wrong. The battery life will last a weekend and the video feature work great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Would not but again
customer_reviews.text: Camera failed just after the one year warranty expired. Called panasonic and they cannot give an estimate to fix. Would not buy this camera again based on the poor after care support
customer_reviews.author: Body building Nut

customer_reviews.title: This camera is great!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great!!! It takes great pictures, for being an all-around rugged camera. Love the size and the fact that I can take it in water and on the trail and not worry about ruining it.
customer_reviews.author: angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great travel cam
customer_reviews.text: Great travel cam, but I wish it had a lens cover. While diving with it, it would occasionally get dragged along coral. It would be nice to have a quick slide on, slide off cover that's easily opened/closed with one hand while diving.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good, Hardy camera with fairly good photos
customer_reviews.text: Works well underwater and has nice color for both out of water and underwater photos. However, we went with a friend who brought the Nikon and their photos were overall better for the underwater shots (crisp and clear) and they had an easier time focusing on their subjects. However, I can easily clean up all the Panasonic photos in processing.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Blurry underwater, but very good elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Good overall camera, however, if you're buying this for the sole purpose of underwater use, I would look elsewhere as we've had a bunch of blurry pictures. It might be waterproof, but that doesn't mean you're getting great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera that would record, not only the time and date, but the GPS coordinates and altitude as well on my photos. This camera does just that without having to run my data through a smartphone and back.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D Richardson

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this camera, but sand got under the shutter button the very first time I used it at the beach. Back it went. If you need something for the pool and not the beach, this would work great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Takes good pics and used it snorkeling just great
customer_reviews.text: Only reason 4 not 5 stars is wifi feature doesn't work well - on trip and trying to send to phone to email and can't get it to work! Takes good pics and used it snorkeling just great!
customer_reviews.author: billybob

customer_reviews.title: Tough Enough
customer_reviews.text: Oregon coast + 75 mph gusts with rain and blowing sand = good pictures. I was snapping pics of the crashing surf in the middle of a Pacific storm hitting the coast and this camera was a champ.
customer_reviews.author: L. Munson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable vacation camera!
customer_reviews.text: Have used now on a number of vacations. Excellent usability, relatively easy interface, and reliable operation. I'd buy the next model when available if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: We have used this in our own pool and taken it on our cruse. As long as you follow the instructions on cleaning and care we have had no issues with water getting in where it should not go. And it has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Ketow

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Really like the wifi transfer
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Really like the wifi transfer. Worked great underwater. Nice overall camera. I need to transfer the rest of my pictures to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bucks

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for travel and outdoor activities
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, takes wonderful photos, and the built-in wifi works well for sharing photos on the go, without need for a computer (I transfer them to a smartphone then upload wherever). The only downside to this camera is that the display screen can't be shut off, so it can drain the battery if you always leave it on between shots.
customer_reviews.author: Hoser1138

customer_reviews.title: We used it every day we were there snorkelling and diving and the pictures are amazing. Perfect for someone looking to buy a wat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for use during a trip to Hawaii. We used it every day we were there snorkelling and diving and the pictures are amazing. Perfect for someone looking to buy a waterproof camera. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JSC

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera at a good price. Very nice underwater shots as well as regular shots. In many ways, it is easier to use than my full-size DSLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Meets all specifications, the menu is a bit tangled but it takes patience and can achieve the right connections, but intuitively it works Ok. It would be advisable to read the manual before using it more than anything in the closure cap, how to clean and then open for use in seawater or sand that can make affects the operation. The connection to the phone is very good, the app works ok. It was worth the investment :)
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Very good after two years
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. It does work under water cold or warm. I am happy with this camera
customer_reviews.author: David Denovellis

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, used for underwater pictures and video, night shots and everything I wanted and even more, nice panoramas also
customer_reviews.author: Pachobv

customer_reviews.title: Great low Fstop, Leica components and wider angle lens makes this camera awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great photos! I use it for a point shoot beyond the beach/water sports. It's wider angle lens and that it has a low Fstop as well as Leica lens components make this an awesome camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie K

customer_reviews.title: It's an awesome little camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present that went down very well. It is an awesome little camera and if I did not have my Fuji, I certainly would have one of these...Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Billybraveheart

customer_reviews.title: Floats nicely
customer_reviews.text: We were completely happy with this camera on our recent Hawaii vacation, particularly after having our micro 4/3 camera drop on a stone floor on day one. That meant we were down to one camera, and the Lumix worked perfectly. We were in the water a fair amount, and it performed well there. I found that setting the video mode to a lower resolution but higher frame rate (60fps) made the resulting videos look better (to me, anyway). If you're wondering about a wrist strap that can successfully float this camera, I can tell you this one works:
customer_reviews.author: John Ross Judson

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS5 16.1 MP Tough Digital Camera with 9.3x Intelligent Zoom (Orange) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
The rugged, waterproof and WiFi-enabled LUMIX TS5 compact adventure camera delivers go-anywhere flexibility with state-of-the-art imaging performance. Unwire your creativity with WiFi technology that allows you to share your pictures instantly from your smartphone. The LUMIX TS5 is the ultimate tough camera, so no matter where you find yourself - diving with sea life, hanging from a mountain, or exploring the winding alleys of a foreign market - you will take the best shot possible without worrying about your camera. Waterproof to 43 feet, shockproof from 6.5 feet, freezeproof from 14 degrees Fahrenheit, and pressure resistant to 220 lbs, the LUMIX TS5 really is the tough-man of the compact camera market. Intelligent HDR and Night Shot Wi-Fi with NFC for easy, One-touch Connection to a Smartphone / Tablet Built-in Stereo Microphone & Torch Light Quad-Indicator - Altimeter/Depth Indicator, Compass, GPS & GLONASS with Place Name and Landmark Information & Barometer Instant Creativity with Built-In Creative Effects - Creative Control/Creative RetouchSpecifications Sensor Size / Total Pixels / Filter - 1/2.33-inch High Sensitivity MOS Sensor / 17.5 Total Megapixels / Primary Color Filter Effective Pixels - 16.1 Megapixels Lens - LEICA DC VARIO-ELMAR, 4.6x Optical Zoom, Anti-fog Glass Focal Length - f = 4.9 - 22.8mm (28 - 128mm in 35mm equiv.) Optical Image Stabilizer - MEGA O.I.S. LCD - 3.0-inch TFT LCD Display (460K dots), AR Coating, 100% Field of View File Format - Still Image - JPEG (DCF/Exif 2.3), DPOF; 3D Image - MPO; Motion Image - AVCHD, MP4 File Size - Still up to 4608 x 3456 (4 - 3); Movie up to FHD 1920 x 1080 (60p), MP4 1280 x 720 (30fps) ISO Sensitivity - Auto 100 - 3200, High 1600-6400 Pressure Resistance - 100 kgf Water Proof - 43 ft. (13m) (IPX8 compliant) Dust Proof - Yes (IPX6 compliant) Freeze Proof - 14 degree F (-10.0 degree C) Shock Proof - 6.6 ft

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



 PANASONIC LUMIX DMC-TS5D COMPACT POINT AND SHOOT DIGITAL CAMERA, RUGGED, WATERPROOF, WIFI-ENABLED, CREATIVE SCENE MODES, GPS, INTELLIGENT AUTO MODE - ORANGE

 CONTROL IT AND SHARE INSTANTLY FROM YOUR SMARTPHONE
The ability to control, save and share your images is at your fingertips with the new WiFi capability of the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-TS5. (Click To Learn More) The WiFi functions of the camera empower you to control, save and share your images easily. Get connected and change your smartphone or tablet into a remote control for your camera by touching the camera to your device. Enjoy the ultimate wireless control with the Panasonic Image App setting the camera's zoom, focus, and shooting from a distance. Get yourself in the photo or video with remote shooting. The DMC-TS5 digital camera will start and stop video recording and view images and videos from your device to ensure you got it. Touch your camera to your friend's device and an image will be transferred. Instantly transfer the photos you shoot to your device, instantly upload and share images on a Social Networking Site, or share your pictures on a large screen TV. 

 INSTANT CREATIVITY WITH BUILT-IN CREATIVE EFFECTS
The Panasonic TS5 point and shot digital camera takes the guesswork out of photography with in-camera effects. Take simple or complicated scenes and make them easy to capture in amazing photos. (Click To Learn More) Take the ordinary and make it extraordinary by fueling your creativity with the in-camera Creative Control feature (in the recording mode) and the Creative Retouch feature (in the playback mode). Take simple or complicated scenes and make them easy to capture in a great photo. Set the camera to match your scene and it uses sophisticated presets to optimize the camera settings resulting in amazing photos. 12 Creative Panorama filter effects take your panorama images to the next level. Delight in the creative possibilities that LUMIX's intelligent HDR (High Dynamic Range) delivers. Shoot several still pictures consecutively at different exposures that are then overlaid to produce a single composite picture without over-exposure or under-exposure. 

 CAPTURE STILLS OR FULL HD VIDEO IN AND OUT OF THE WATER
Video recording can be easily started with the press of the Motion Picture Button making it convenient for switching between photo and video shooting instantly. (Click To Learn More)Reach new heights in speed and creative possibilities with your videos. Capture all the action while recording full HD 1,920 x 1,080 videos in AVCHD Progressive (MPEG-4 / H.264) format. With the TS5 featuring 60p (NTSC) full HD recording capability, subjects with fast motion or fine details will be reproduced clearly. The Red Color Reproduction of in-camera Advanced Underwater Mode compensates for the color red that is easily lost in underwater photography. Your underwater pictures that look more natural. The powerful 4.6x optical zoom is available in video recording to capture subjects in the distance and bring you closer to the action.

 5 PROOF PROTECTIONS FOR A TOUGH, SMART TRAVEL COMPANION
In addition to being waterproof, shockproof, dustproof and freezeproof, the durable Panasonic LUMIX DMC-TS5 compact digital camera also boasts pressure resistance. (Click To Learn More) The Panasonic DMC-TS5 is waterproof, shockproof, dustproof and freezeproof, and boasts pressure resistance. Take this camera with you on all of your photographic journeys. From fishing or camping, diving, snorkeling, surfing, mountain climbing, or skiing and snowboarding, the TS5 point and shot is an all-year-round camera that records stunning memories in beautiful photos and videos. It features pressure resistance of 100 kgf thanks to the reinforced rib structure of its internal design, waterproof to a depth of 43ft, shockproof from a height of 6.6ft, dustproof, and freezeproof to 14 degrees Fahrenheit so get out and shoot your favorite activities.

 QUAD INDICATORS: ALTIMETER, COMPASS, DEPTH, BAROMETER
The TS5 digital camera was made for your active outdoor lifestyle. Take advantage of altimeter, compass, depth, and barometer features making it your ultimate adventure tool. (Click To Learn More) The DMC-TS5 digital camera is specially designed for active outdoor use. It adopts GPS, compass, altimeter and even barometer features to show and record altitude, barometric pressure and orientation data. The barometer also works for underwater depth.

 GPS AND GLONASS
Take advantage of both GPS and GLONASS navigation systems for accuracy and real-time information when taking photos. (Click To Learn More) In-camera's navigation system supports GPS (Global Positioning System) as well as GLONASS (Global Navigation Satellite System), taking advantage of it's increased number of satellites, giving you better accuracy. The LUMIX's navigation GPS shows the name of the Country/Region, State/Prov/County, County/Township, City/Town/Village and Landmark using the internal data to give you real-time information on your location when taking photos. In addition to the Altimeter logging function, the TS5 records GPS logging. This allows memorizing travel distances which can be displayed on the Google Earth application.

 POWER O.I.S. FOR SHARP, VIBRATION FREE PHOTOGRAPHY
The in-camera POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) suppresses vibration and hand-shake that happens when you press the shutter button or when shooting at night with a slow shutter speed. (Click To View Larger) The Power O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) compensates for hand-shake that causes blurred photos. Even slight hand-shake movement is accurately detected and compensated for to produce sharp, clear images. Bring on the night portraits or scenes, shoot in dimly lit rooms, hand-hold a macro shot, or shoot underwater with confidence that the Power O.I.S. will keep your pictures sharp.

 IA (INTELLIGENT AUTO) MODE TAKES THE GUESSWORK OUT OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Take your photography to the next level with the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-TS5's iA (Intelligent Auto) Mode. Simply aim, press, and shoot while the camera goes to work to give you beautiful photos and videos. (Click To View Larger) Your photography will soar to new levels with the DMC-TS5 digital camera's state-of-the-art features and technologies like the iA (Intelligent Auto) Mode. The point and shot camera does the technical setting work, leaving you free to compose your shot and capture the moment. Simply aim, press, and shoot. The detection and correction functions go to work to give you beautiful photos and videos. Keep in mind the iA Mode functions vary with photos and videos.

 PREMIUM ACCESSORIES FOR THE PANASONIC LUMIX DMC-TS5
Panasonic DMW-BCG10 ID Secured Battery
ID Secured Battery for LUMIX Digital Cameras USB Connection Cable DMW-USBC1
USB rewind type cable, maximum cable length 1.5m AV Cable
AV Cable for select LUMIX Digital Cameras Panasonic RP-CDHM30 Mini 1.3c HDMI cable
Premium 10 ft Panasonic RP-CDHM30 Mini 1.3c HDMI cable
 WATERPROOF & TOUGH COMPARISON CHART

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars398 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
